meanings.definition: A person employed in an office or bank to keep records, accounts, and perform other routine tasks.
meanings.sent1: The clerk at the bank helped me deposit money.
meanings.sent2: The clerk organized the files in the office.
meanings.sent3: The clerk joked that the stapler was his best friend.
meanings.sent4: The clerk's mind was like a filing cabinet, storing information neatly.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the clerk's meticulous record-keeping skills.

meanings.definition: To work as a clerk in a store or office.
meanings.sent1: She decided to clerk at the bookstore during the summer.
meanings.sent2: He will clerk at the law firm starting next week.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would clerk, but here I am!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to clerk efficiently impressed her supervisor.
meanings.sent5: Clerking requires attention to detail and organization.

meanings.definition: A person who works in a store and assists customers.
meanings.sent1: The clerk at the store helped me find the right size.
meanings.sent2: The friendly clerk greeted every customer with a smile.
meanings.sent3: The clerk playfully suggested a pair of socks for my car.
meanings.sent4: The clerk's helpfulness shone like a beacon in the store.
meanings.sent5: I always appreciate a knowledgeable clerk when shopping.
